original:
Library hosts many events on weekends and is popular with local families.
It has an attached cafe, so visitors can relax and enjoy to read at a leisurely pace.
It is relatively quiet, making it an ideal place for people who want to focus study and work.
It offers quiet private rooms that can be used by reservation, which is especially appealing.
corrected:
The library hosts many events on weekends and is popular with local families.

It has an attached cafe, so visitors can relax and enjoy reading at a leisurely pace.

On weekdays, it is relatively quiet, making it an ideal place for people who want to focus on study and work.

In particular, it offers quiet private rooms that can be used by reservation, which is especially appealing.

model_answer:
This library hosts many events on weekends and is popular with local families.

It has an attached cafe, so visitors can relax and enjoy reading at a leisurely pace.

On the other hand, on weekdays, it is relatively quiet, making it an ideal environment for people who want to concentrate on studying or working.

In particular, there are quiet private rooms available for reservation, which is especially attractive.
model_answer_explanation:
文法・表現のポイント解説

1文目: This library hosts many events on weekends and is popular with local families.
（この図書館は週末には多くのイベントが開催されており、地域の家族連れに人気があります。）
weekends（名詞：週末：土曜日と日曜日を指す）／holidays（名詞：祝日：特定の日の休暇を指す）で、weekendsは毎週の土日、holidaysは特定の休みを指します。
【参考】on weekends（週末に）／during holidays（祝日に）
例：I relax on weekends. (週末にリラックスします。)／We travel during holidays. (祝日に旅行します。)

2文目: It has an attached cafe, so visitors can relax and enjoy reading at a leisurely pace.
（また、カフェが併設されているため、ゆっくりと読書を楽しむこともできます。）
leisurely（副詞：ゆっくりと：急がずにのんびりとしたペースで）／slowly（副詞：ゆっくりと：速度が遅い）で、leisurelyはリラックスしたペース、slowlyは速度に焦点を当てます。
【参考】at a leisurely pace（ゆっくりとしたペースで）／move slowly（ゆっくり動く）
例：She walks at a leisurely pace. (彼女はゆっくりと歩きます。)／The car moves slowly. (車はゆっくりと動きます。)

3文目: On the other hand, on weekdays, it is relatively quiet, making it an ideal environment for people who want to concentrate on studying or working.
（一方で、平日は比較的静かで、勉強や仕事に集中したい人々にとって理想的な環境です。）
concentrate（動詞：集中する：注意を一つのことに向ける）／focus（動詞：焦点を合わせる：特定のことに注意を向ける）で、concentrateは意識的な注意、focusは注意の中心を指します。
【参考】concentrate on（〜に集中する）／focus on（〜に焦点を合わせる）
例：He concentrates on his work. (彼は仕事に集中しています。)／She focuses on her studies. (彼女は勉強に焦点を合わせています。)

4文目: In particular, there are quiet private rooms available for reservation, which is especially attractive.
（特に、静かな個室があり、予約制で利用できることが魅力です。）
reservation（名詞：予約：事前に確保すること）／appointment（名詞：予約：人との約束）で、reservationは場所や物の予約、appointmentは人との約束を指します。
【参考】make a reservation（予約をする）／schedule an appointment（約束をする）
例：I made a reservation for dinner. (夕食の予約をしました。)／He scheduled an appointment with the doctor. (彼は医者との予約を取りました。)
